page.title: 12Religion - Brompton on Swale
page.content: Most people in the area are nominally Church of England.There is a church in Catterick dedicated to St Anne and St Paul's in Brompton on Swale,which is a chapel of ease for Easby church.There is also a Methodist chapel in Brompton and another in Colburn.St Paul's church has Sunday School every Sunday after the morning service. Children from 4-11 attend these classes.The church also has a Mothers Union.There is a Monday Club which uses the Methodist Chapel. At Monday Club we sing songs,play games and read the bible.The members of Monday Club are children aged 5-11. There used to be a youth club for teenagers and children but it is no longer running.The new C.of E. primary school in Brompton-on-Swale opened in 1983.The old school has recently become a church hall again.
